column1: Schneverdingen (German pronunciation: [ˈʃneːvɐdɪŋən]; Low Saxon Snevern) is a city in the northern part of the district of Heidekreis
column3: Germany. It is located in the area known as Lüneburg Heath.

column1: Schneverdingen is situated approximately 15 km (9 mi) north of Soltau
column2: and 50 km (31 mi) south of Hamburg.

column1: Schneverdingen belonged to the Prince-Bishopric of Verden
column2: established in 1180. In 1648 the Prince-Bishopric was transformed into the Principality of Verden
column3: which was first ruled in personal union by the Swedish Crown - interrupted by a Danish occupation (1712–1715) - and from 1715 on by the Hanoverian Crown. The Kingdom of Hanover incorporated the Principality in a real union and the Princely territory
column5: became part of the new Stade Region
